result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlie D Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder- While committing Armed Robbery, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $1,100.00 to Keonte Blackwell and $6,855.00 to Tamika Holmes.  Joint and several with Ricky Allen 15CF307.

All court costs, surcharges, DNA surcharge  and restitution to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

records.addlTxt: per remittitur dated April 26, 2017, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Thomas J. Erickson is relieved of any further representation of Charlie D. Johnson.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING TRANSCRIPT (35 pages) commencing 09/17/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.
 Sentencing proceeded.  Private Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Maiyah T.
 The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 20 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 244 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 13 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Defendant stipulates to pay restitution as follows: $1100.00 to Keonte Blackwell and $6855.00 to Tamika Holmes, joint and several with Ricky Allen (15CF307)
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges, DNA surcharge                                                                                                                                   
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Ineligible Voting; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Credit
FILED, ALTERNATIVE PRESENTENCE INVESTIGATION REPORT
Written Stipulation signed by defendant, defense counsel and the state to adjourn sentencing from 8-10-2015 to 9-17-2015 to allow for completion of PSI by defense.

Atty Mayaan Silver contacted the court to request an adjournment of the sentencing currently set for 8-10-2015 to allow her PSI writer the needed time.  Clerk informed counsel that she must obtain a signed stipulation from the state and defendant to adjourn sentencing.

Atty M. Silver called the court regarding the defense's private PSI. The writer of the PSI is unable to complete the report prior to the previously scheduled sentencing date of 8/10/15, as the writer will be gone for the month of July. Defense is requesting an adjournment for the completion of the report. Parties agree on September 17 at 8:15 for sentencing with PSI. Case will remain calendared for sentencing on 8/10/15 pending approval of the Court.
Received and filed.
Received and filed.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a final pre-trial.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.    All parties are notified that branch 38 will hear sentencing and that this case will be heard in Room 504 of the Courthouse. Parties waive a pre-sentence investigation, defense to obtain a private report prior to sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Maayan Silver.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is moving to modify the $25,000 cash bail to $10,000 cash.  State argues that the cash bail should be increased. 
The court denies the motion to modify and orders the $25,000 cash bail to stand.
for bail modification filed by defense.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Charlie D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting another final pretrial has she was ill all last week.  State has no objection.
Final pretrial set for 6-22-2015.

Attorney Maayan Silver in court, defendant Charlie D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk:  ss

Case heard as to status on counsel.  New counsel advised the court that she has not received discovery to date.  Court ordered the case adjourned for status conference in Branch 38.  Court also set a backup date for the trial.  Jury trial scheduled for 06-29-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Reyna Morales appears and informs the court that there is a conflict and private bar counsel will need to be appointed.  Case is adjourned to 5-7-2015 at 8:15 for status of new counsel.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is moving to withdraw as the family is not able to meet the financial obligations of payment.  The state does not object to withdrawal.  Court will grant motion and orders that the case be referred to SPD.  Atty Klimetz will contact SPD and advise that there is a trial set for 6-1-2015.
Case set for 5-1-2015 for status of counsel.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: to Withdraw as Counsel filed.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Charlie D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held.  Defense received discovery today and will need time to review with defendant.
Case set for final pretrial on 4-23-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-1-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-25-2015.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court, defendant Charlie D Johnson not in court, in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state has not received discovery from MPD yet; as soon as received it will be forwarded to defense counsel.  Co-defendant is set for Preliminary hearing on 2-17-2015.  Both cases are to be set for scheduling on 2-23-2015 at 8:15.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Scott Lackovic-MPD Detective, Matthew Bell-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:15 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Charlie D Johnson in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Charlie D Johnson in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
